trans-unit.source: Represents the base class for a tabular data-bound control that is composed of other server controls.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl> class serves as the base class for a composite server control that binds to data from a data source.
A composite server control is a control that is built from a combination of other server controls.
Page developers do not use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl> class directly; instead, they use controls that derive from this class.
Examples of composite data-bound controls include the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> controls.

Classes that inherit from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl> control must override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl.CreateChildControls%28System.Collections.IEnumerable%2CSystem.Boolean%29> method to create the control hierarchy.
To access the child controls of a composite data-bound control, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl.Controls%2A> collection.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl"></xref> class.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl> class is an abstract class.
You cannot create a new instance of this class.
Gets a collection of the child controls within the composite data-bound control.
A composite data-bound control is a combination of one or more server controls.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl.Controls%2A> property to manage these child controls.
You can add, remove, or iterate through the server controls in the collection.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> that represents the child controls within the composite data-bound control.
Creates the control hierarchy that is used to render a composite data-bound control based on the values that are stored in view state.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl.CreateChildControls> method is a helper method that is used by classes that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl> class to create the control hierarchy for a composite data-bound control.
This overload of the method creates the control hierarchy based on values from view state, rather than directly from the data source.
When overridden in an abstract class, creates the control hierarchy that is used to render the composite data-bound control based on the values from the specified data source.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl.CreateChildControls> method is a helper method that is used by classes that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl> class to create the control hierarchy for a composite data-bound control.

When extending the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl> class, you must override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl.CreateChildControls> method to create your own control hierarchy.
For more information on creating a composite control, see [Developing Custom ASP.NET Server Controls](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/fbe26c16-cff4-4089-b3dd-877411f0c0ef).
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerable"></xref> that contains the values to bind to the control.

`true` to indicate that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl.CreateChildControls(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Boolean)"></xref> is called during data binding; otherwise, `false`.
The number of items created by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl.CreateChildControls(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Boolean)"></xref>.
Gets or sets the name of the method to call in order to delete data.
Setting this property causes model binding to be used as the data-binding method.
For a tutorial series on using model binding with Web Forms, see [Model Binding and Web Forms](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=286117).
The name of the method.
Gets or sets the name of the method to call in order to insert data.
Setting this property causes model binding to be used as the data-binding method.
For a tutorial series on using model binding with Web Forms, see [Model Binding and Web Forms](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=286117).
The name of the method.
Gets a value that indicates whether model binding is in use.
`true` if model binding is in use; otherwise, `false`.
Binds the data from the data source to the composite data-bound control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl.PerformDataBinding%2A> method is a helper method that is used by classes that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl> class to bind the data from the data source to the composite data-bound control.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerable"></xref> that contains the values to bind to the composite data-bound control.
Gets or sets the name of the method to call in order to update data.
Setting this property causes model binding to be used as the data-binding method.
For a tutorial series on using model binding with Web Forms, see [Model Binding and Web Forms](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=286117).
The name of the method.
